rows.arabic: ٱقْتَرَبَتِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ وَٱنشَقَّ ٱلْقَمَرُ
rows.translation: The Hour (of Judgment) is nigh, and the moon is cleft asunder.
rows.transliteration: iqtarabatis sā`atu wanshaqqal qamar

bismillah.translation: In the name of Allah, Most Gracious, Most Merciful.

rows.arabic: وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ ءَايَةً يُعْرِضُوا۟ وَيَقُولُوا۟ سِحْرٌ مُّسْتَمِرٌّ
rows.translation: But if they see a Sign, they turn away, and say, "This is (but) transient magic."
rows.transliteration: wa in yaraw āyatan yu`riḍū wayaqūlū siḥrun mustamirr

rows.arabic: وَكَذَّبُوا۟ وَٱتَّبَعُوٓا۟ أَهْوَآءَهُمْ ۚ وَكُلُّ أَمْرٍ مُّسْتَقِرٌّ
rows.translation: They reject (the warning) and follow their (own) lusts but every matter has its appointed time.
rows.transliteration: wakadhhabū wattaba`ū ahwā-ahum ۚ wakullu amrin mustaqirr

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَآءَهُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَنۢبَآءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزْدَجَرٌ
rows.translation: There have already come to them Recitals wherein there is (enough) to check (them),
rows.transliteration: walaqad jā-ahum minal-anbā-i mā fīhi muzdajar

rows.arabic: حِكْمَةٌۢ بَـٰلِغَةٌ ۖ فَمَا تُغْنِ ٱلنُّذُرُ
rows.translation: Mature wisdom;- but (the preaching of) Warners profits them not.
rows.transliteration: ḥikmatun bālighah ۖ famā tughnin nudhur

rows.arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ ۘ يَوْمَ يَدْعُ ٱلدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَىْءٍ نُّكُرٍ
rows.translation: Therefore, (O Prophet,) turn away from them. The Day that the Caller will call (them) to a terrible affair,
rows.transliteration: fatawalla `anhum ۘ yawma yad`ud dā`i ilā shay-in nukur

rows.arabic: خُشَّعًا أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلْأَجْدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمْ جَرَادٌ مُّنتَشِرٌ
rows.translation: They will come forth,- their eyes humbled - from (their) graves, (torpid) like locusts scattered abroad,
rows.transliteration: khushha`an abṣāruhum yakhrujūna minal-ajdāthi ka-annahum jarādun muntashir

rows.arabic: مُّهْطِعِينَ إِلَى ٱلدَّاعِ ۖ يَقُولُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ هَـٰذَا يَوْمٌ عَسِرٌ
rows.translation: Hastening, with eyes transfixed, towards the Caller!- "Hard is this Day!", the Unbelievers will say.
rows.transliteration: muhṭi`īna ilad dā` ۖ yaqūlul kāfirūna hādhā yawmun `asir

rows.arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ فَكَذَّبُوا۟ عَبْدَنَا وَقَالُوا۟ مَجْنُونٌ وَٱزْدُجِرَ
rows.translation: Before them the People of Noah rejected (their messenger): they rejected Our servant, and said, "Here is one possessed!", and he was driven out.
rows.transliteration: kadhhabat qablahum qawmu nūḥin fakadhhabū `abdanā waqālū majnūnun wazdujir

rows.arabic: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّى مَغْلُوبٌ فَٱنتَصِرْ
rows.translation: Then he called on his Lord: "I am one overcome: do Thou then help (me)!"
rows.transliteration: fada`ā rabbahu annī maghlūbun fantaṣir

rows.arabic: فَفَتَحْنَآ أَبْوَٰبَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَآءٍ مُّنْهَمِرٍ
rows.translation: So We opened the gates of heaven, with water pouring forth.
rows.transliteration: fafataḥnā abwābas samā-i bimā-in munhamir

rows.arabic: وَفَجَّرْنَا ٱلْأَرْضَ عُيُونًا فَٱلْتَقَى ٱلْمَآءُ عَلَىٰٓ أَمْرٍ قَدْ قُدِرَ
rows.translation: And We caused the earth to gush forth with springs, so the waters met (and rose) to the extent decreed.
rows.transliteration: wafajjarnal-arḍa `uyūnan fal taqal mā-u `alā amrin qad qudir

rows.arabic: وَحَمَلْنَـٰهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلْوَٰحٍ وَدُسُرٍ
rows.translation: But We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fibre:
rows.transliteration: waḥamalnāhu `alā dhāti alwāḥin wadusur

rows.arabic: تَجْرِى بِأَعْيُنِنَا جَزَآءً لِّمَن كَانَ كُفِرَ
rows.translation: She floats under our eyes (and care): a recompense to one who had been rejected (with scorn)!
rows.transliteration: tajrī bi-a`yuninā jazā-an liman kāna kufir

rows.arabic: وَلَقَد تَّرَكْنَـٰهَآ ءَايَةً فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
rows.translation: And We have left this as a Sign (for all time): then is there any that will receive admonition?
rows.transliteration: walaqad taraknāhā āyatan fahal min muddakir

rows.arabic: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
rows.translation: But how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning?
rows.transliteration: fakayfa kāna `adhābī wanudhur

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
rows.translation: And We have indeed made the Qur'an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
rows.transliteration: walaqad yassarnal qur-āna lidhhikri fahal min muddakir

rows.arabic: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
rows.translation: The 'Ad (people) (too) rejected (Truth): then how terrible was My Penalty and My Warning?
rows.transliteration: kadhhabat `ādun fakayfa kāna `adhābī wanudhur

rows.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِيحًا صَرْصَرًا فِى يَوْمِ نَحْسٍ مُّسْتَمِرٍّ
rows.translation: For We sent against them a furious wind, on a Day of violent Disaster,
rows.transliteration: innā arsalnā `alayhim rīḥan ṣarṣaran fī yawmi naḥsin mustamirr

rows.arabic: تَنزِعُ ٱلنَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ مُّنقَعِرٍ
rows.translation: Plucking out men as if they were roots of palm-trees torn up (from the ground).
rows.transliteration: tanzi`un nāsa ka-annahum a`jāzu nakhlin munqa`ir

rows.arabic: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
rows.translation: Yea, how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning!
rows.transliteration: fakayfa kāna `adhābī wanudhur

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
rows.translation: But We have indeed made the Qur'an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
rows.transliteration: walaqad yassarnal qur-āna lidhhikri fahal min muddakir

rows.arabic: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
rows.translation: The Thamud (also) rejected (their) Warners.
rows.transliteration: kadhhabat thamūdu bin nudhur

rows.arabic: فَقَالُوٓا۟ أَبَشَرًا مِّنَّا وَٰحِدًا نَّتَّبِعُهُۥٓ إِنَّآ إِذًا لَّفِى ضَلَـٰلٍ وَسُعُرٍ
rows.translation: For they said: "What! a man! a Solitary one from among ourselves! shall we follow such a one? Truly should we then be straying in mind, and mad!
rows.transliteration: faqālū abasharan minnā wāḥidan nattabi`uhu innā idhal lafī ḍalālin wasu`ur

rows.arabic: أَءُلْقِىَ ٱلذِّكْرُ عَلَيْهِ مِنۢ بَيْنِنَا بَلْ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٌ
rows.translation: "Is it that the Message is sent to him, of all people amongst us? Nay, he is a liar, an insolent one!"
rows.transliteration: a-ulqiyadh dhikru `alayhi min bayninā bal huwa kadhhābun ashir

rows.arabic: سَيَعْلَمُونَ غَدًا مَّنِ ٱلْكَذَّابُ ٱلْأَشِرُ
rows.translation: Ah! they will know on the morrow, which is the liar, the insolent one!
rows.transliteration: saya`lamūna ghadan manil kadhhābul-ashir

rows.arabic: إِنَّا مُرْسِلُوا۟ ٱلنَّاقَةِ فِتْنَةً لَّهُمْ فَٱرْتَقِبْهُمْ وَٱصْطَبِرْ
rows.translation: For We will send the she-camel by way of trial for them. So watch them, (O Salih), and possess thyself in patience!
rows.transliteration: innā mursilun nāqati fitnatan lahum fartaqibhum waṣṭabir

rows.arabic: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ أَنَّ ٱلْمَآءَ قِسْمَةٌۢ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ كُلُّ شِرْبٍ مُّحْتَضَرٌ
rows.translation: And tell them that the water is to be divided between them: Each one's right to drink being brought forward (by suitable turns).
rows.transliteration: wanabbi-hum annal mā-a qismatun baynahum ۖ kullu shirbin muḥtaḍar

rows.arabic: فَنَادَوْا۟ صَاحِبَهُمْ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ
rows.translation: But they called to their companion, and he took a sword in hand, and hamstrung (her).
rows.transliteration: fanādaw ṣāḥibahum fata`āṭā fa`aqar

rows.arabic: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
rows.translation: Ah! how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning!
rows.transliteration: fakayfa kāna `adhābī wanudhur

rows.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ صَيْحَةً وَٰحِدَةً فَكَانُوا۟ كَهَشِيمِ ٱلْمُحْتَظِرِ
rows.translation: For We sent against them a single Mighty Blast, and they became like the dry stubble used by one who pens cattle.
rows.transliteration: innā arsalnā `alayhim ṣayḥatan wāḥidatan fakānū kahashīmil muḥtaẓir

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
rows.translation: And We have indeed made the Qur'an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
rows.transliteration: walaqad yassarnal qur-āna lidhhikri fahal min muddakir

rows.arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍۭ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
rows.translation: The people of Lut rejected (his) warning.
rows.transliteration: kadhhabat qawmu lūṭin bin nudhur

rows.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حَاصِبًا إِلَّآ ءَالَ لُوطٍ ۖ نَّجَّيْنَـٰهُم بِسَحَرٍ
rows.translation: We sent against them a violent Tornado with showers of stones, (which destroyed them), except Lut's household: them We delivered by early Dawn,-
rows.transliteration: innā arsalnā `alayhim ḥāṣiban illā āla lūṭ ۖ najjaynāhum bisaḥar

rows.arabic: نِّعْمَةً مِّنْ عِندِنَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى مَن شَكَرَ
rows.translation: As a Grace from Us: thus do We reward those who give thanks.
rows.transliteration: ni`matan min `indinā ۚ kadhālika najzī man shakar

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَنذَرَهُم بَطْشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوْا۟ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
rows.translation: And (Lut) did warn them of Our Punishment, but they disputed about the Warning.
rows.transliteration: walaqad andharahum baṭshatanā fatamāraw bin nudhur

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ رَٰوَدُوهُ عَن ضَيْفِهِۦ فَطَمَسْنَآ أَعْيُنَهُمْ فَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
rows.translation: And they even sought to snatch away his guests from him, but We blinded their eyes. (They heard:) "Now taste ye My Wrath and My Warning."
rows.transliteration: walaqad rāwadūhu `an ḍayfihi faṭamasnā a`yunahum fadhūqū `adhābī wanudhur

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ صَبَّحَهُم بُكْرَةً عَذَابٌ مُّسْتَقِرٌّ
rows.translation: Early on the morrow an abiding Punishment seized them:
rows.transliteration: walaqad ṣabbaḥahum bukratan `adhābun mustaqirr

rows.arabic: فَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
rows.translation: "So taste ye My Wrath and My Warning."
rows.transliteration: fadhūqū `adhābī wanudhur

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
rows.translation: And We have indeed made the Qur'an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
rows.transliteration: walaqad yassarnal qur-āna lidhhikri fahal min muddakir

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَآءَ ءَالَ فِرْعَوْنَ ٱلنُّذُرُ
rows.translation: To the People of Pharaoh, too, aforetime, came Warners (from Allah).
rows.transliteration: walaqad jā-a āla fir`awnan nudhur

rows.arabic: كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذْنَـٰهُمْ أَخْذَ عَزِيزٍ مُّقْتَدِرٍ
rows.translation: The (people) rejected all Our Signs; but We seized them with such Penalty (as comes) from One Exalted in Power, able to carry out His Will.
rows.transliteration: kadhhabū bi-āyātinā kullihā fa-akhadhnāhum akhdha `azīzin muqtadir

rows.arabic: أَكُفَّارُكُمْ خَيْرٌ مِّنْ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكُمْ أَمْ لَكُم بَرَآءَةٌ فِى ٱلزُّبُرِ
rows.translation: Are your Unbelievers, (O Quraish), better than they? Or have ye an immunity in the Sacred Books?
rows.transliteration: akuffārukum khayrun min ulā-ikum am lakum barā-atun fiz zubur

rows.arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ نَحْنُ جَمِيعٌ مُّنتَصِرٌ
rows.translation: Or do they say: "We acting together can defend ourselves"?
rows.transliteration: am yaqūlūna naḥnu jamī`un muntaṣir

rows.arabic: سَيُهْزَمُ ٱلْجَمْعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ ٱلدُّبُرَ
rows.translation: Soon will their multitude be put to flight, and they will show their backs.
rows.transliteration: sayuhzamul jam`u wayuwallūnad dubur

rows.arabic: بَلِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ مَوْعِدُهُمْ وَٱلسَّاعَةُ أَدْهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ
rows.translation: Nay, the Hour (of Judgment) is the time promised them (for their full recompense): And that Hour will be most grievous and most bitter.
rows.transliteration: balis sā`atu maw`iduhum was sā`atu ad-hā wa-amarr

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍ وَسُعُرٍ
rows.translation: Truly those in sin are the ones straying in mind, and mad.
rows.transliteration: innal mujrimīna fī ḍalālin wasu`ur

rows.arabic: يَوْمَ يُسْحَبُونَ فِى ٱلنَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ ذُوقُوا۟ مَسَّ سَقَرَ
rows.translation: The Day they will be dragged through the Fire on their faces, (they will hear:) "Taste ye the touch of Hell!"
rows.transliteration: yawma yus-ḥabūna fin nāri `alā wujūhihim dhūqū massa saqar

rows.arabic: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَىْءٍ خَلَقْنَـٰهُ بِقَدَرٍ
rows.translation: Verily, all things have We created in proportion and measure.
rows.transliteration: innā kulla shay-in khalaqnāhu biqadar

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَمْرُنَآ إِلَّا وَٰحِدَةٌ كَلَمْحٍۭ بِٱلْبَصَرِ
rows.translation: And Our Command is but a single (Act),- like the twinkling of an eye.
rows.transliteration: wa mā amrunā illā wāḥidatun kalamḥin bil baṣar

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَهْلَكْنَآ أَشْيَاعَكُمْ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
rows.translation: And (oft) in the past, have We destroyed gangs like unto you: then is there any that will receive admonition?
rows.transliteration: walaqad ahlaknā ashyā`akum fahal min muddakir

rows.arabic: وَكُلُّ شَىْءٍ فَعَلُوهُ فِى ٱلزُّبُرِ
rows.translation: All that they do is noted in (their) Books (of Deeds):
rows.transliteration: wakullu shay-in fa`alūhu fiz zubur

rows.arabic: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٍ وَكَبِيرٍ مُّسْتَطَرٌ
rows.translation: Every matter, small and great, is on record.
rows.transliteration: wakullu ṣaghīrin wakabīrin mustaṭar

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى جَنَّـٰتٍ وَنَهَرٍ
rows.translation: As to the Righteous, they will be in the midst of Gardens and Rivers,
rows.transliteration: innal muttaqīna fī jannātin wanahar

rows.arabic: فِى مَقْعَدِ صِدْقٍ عِندَ مَلِيكٍ مُّقْتَدِرٍۭ
rows.translation: In an Assembly of Truth, in the Presence of a Sovereign Omnipotent.
rows.transliteration: fī maq`adi ṣidqin `inda malīkin muqtadir
